title: the compiler unexpectedly panicked (when running this command: cargo test --color=always --no-run --package cache_proj --lib cache::bucket::tests)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.56.1 binary: rustc commit-hash: unknown commit-date: unknown host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.56.1 LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1147:9 stack backtrace: 0: 0x106b9c861 - std::sys::unix::thread::Thread::new::thread_start::h96b3fd9d7d5e1337 42: 0x7fff204e08fc - __pthread_start note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.58.0-nightly (46b8e7488 2021-11-07) running on x86_64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C split-debuginfo=unpacked -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental -C target-cpu=native -C opt-level=3 -C debuginfo=0 -C target-feature=+popcnt note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [adt_def] computing ADT definition for `cache::cl::CacheLine` #1 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack error: could not compile `cache_proj` Process finished with exit code 101```
